thread.section_title: Antonio Conte targets Chelsea bid for Manchester United’s Jesse Lingard – Metro
thread.title: Antonio Conte targets Chelsea bid for Manchester United’s Jesse Lingard
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte targets Chelsea bid for Manchester United’s Jesse Lingard

author: Chris Davie
title: Antonio Conte targets Chelsea bid for Manchester United’s Jesse Lingard
text:
Jesse Lingard is wanted by Chelsea. (AMA/Getty Images) Antonio Conte wants Chelsea to launch a move for Manchester United winger Jesse Lingard, according to reports.
The Sun claims that the Italian values the 24-year-old’s versatility and sees him playing either as a wing-back or as a forward in his system at Stamford Bridge.
Lingard will only have one year remaining on his contract with United this summer, meaning that the Premier League leaders could sign him for a cut-price fee.
The report claims that a new deal with United has not yet been finalised, meaning that the midfielder’s future remains up in the air.
(Getty Images) (Man Utd via Getty Images) More: Football Two Chelsea stars are feeling very confident ahead of Man Utd clash, reveals Fellaini 
Michael Owen names the teams who will dump Arsenal out of the FA Cup 
Arsenal fans call their own supporters a joke over 'Wexit' banner 
Lingard has been with United since the age of seven and was given his first-team debut by Louis van Gaal in the Dutchman’s first official game as manager in 2014.
This season under Jose Mourinho, Lingard has started only nine Premier League games and has made another five appearances off the bench.

MORE: Arsene Wenger sends message to Alexis Sanchez after addressing Arsenal’s senior players
